medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient began experiencing recurrent fevers at age 5, with her first febrile episode lasting 5 days and accompanied by loss of appetite. Subsequent episodes occurred approximately every 45 days over the past 8 years. Recently, the intervals between episodes have gradually increased to every 3-4 months. During febrile episodes, symptoms typically resolve within 24 hours after onset.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient was born through natural vaginal delivery and had no significant medical history before age 5. Includes history of recurrent urinary tract infections (UTIs).
